org.jsapar

Class TextComposer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jsapar.TextComposer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Composer

    public class TextComposer
extends Object
implements Composer
    This class contains methods for transforming a Document or Line into a text output. E.g. if you want to write the Document to a file you should first set the schema, use a FileWriter and call the Composer.compose(Document) method.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TextComposer(Schema schema, Writer writer)
      Creates an TextComposer with a schema.
      TextComposer(Schema schema, Writer writer, ComposerFactory composerFactory)
      Creates an TextComposer with a schema allowing to add custom SchemaComposer.

        Creates an TextComposer with a schema.

      • TextComposer

        public TextComposer(Schema schema,
                    Writer writer,
                    ComposerFactory composerFactory)
        Creates an TextComposer with a schema allowing to add custom SchemaComposer.
        Parameters:
        schema - The schema to use.
        writer - The writer to write to.
        composerFactory - A factory interface for creating SchemaComposer based on schema.

    • Method Detail

      • composeLine

        public boolean composeLine(Line line)
        Writes the single line to a Writer according to the line type of the line. The line is prefixed with the line separator unless it is the first line.
        Specified by:
        composeLine in interface Composer
        Parameters:
        line - The line to write.
        Returns:
        True if the line was written, false if there was no matching line type in the schema.
        Throws:
        UncheckedIOException - if io-error occurs.

      • setErrorEventListener

        public void setErrorEventListener(ErrorEventListener errorListener)
        Description copied from interface: Composer
        Sets an error event listener to this composer. If you want to add more than one error event listeners, use the MulticastErrorEventListener
        Specified by:
        setErrorEventListener in interface Composer
        Parameters:
        errorListener - The error event listener to add.

      • getSchema

        public Schema getSchema()
        Returns:
        the schema
